embeds.title: Robo-Chop
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton

Deal 9 (10) damage.
Next turn, draw 1 (2) additional card (cards).

messages.content: I've seen this three times in different mods
which is funny
what mods
the cursed
and the marked
Return is technically card draw if you don't think about it
I don't really run this card much; basically is a lesser form of card draw compared to <goto>

embeds.title: Goto
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton

Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
**Encode.**
**Compile** - Next turn, draw 1 (2) card (cards).

messages.content: It's like the definition of an act 1 damage card
once you get through auto's deck once you cut the deck size in half if you are going for compile strat; maybe for a status deck this could be great?
You take this card to not die to nob/lagavulin
sure, I think like I'd take a compile damage/block card over this in majority of packs at the start of act 1
because compiled functions that have 1 attack become an attack card, and nob dies in 2 deck cycles normally etc
I like this card when upgraded
I mean if you get unlucky and the game just offers you skills
it's basically "delayed pommel strike"

fine tuning
safeguard
invalidate
deprecate
Worse numbers than pommel
what
it has the exact same numbers
<Pommel Strike>

messages.content: Oh
Could've sworn it was 12
pommel draws turn played I think is an important factor as well
Guess I misremembered
I would take invalidate over robo chop in act 1
I would as well

yeah idk maybe I need to try it more, just haven't really had any desire to play it when I could just compile a card for double the value (turn played you get the effect, then after function compiled you get a 2nd play + whatever compile bonus)
Mainly because the vulnerable helps in killing and is 0 cost

it is
but remember that auto can shrink their deck really well
so that's why robo chop is worse than pommel strike
right yeah the turn delay for sure
I agree with that deck shrinking point
so maybe a status deck could make better use of robo-chop?
I haven't really played many status decks
That award goes to <gelatinous cube> instead

embeds.title: Gelatinous Cube
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All

Whenever you draw a **Status** card, draw 1 card.
*Hey, it stuck to your body.*

messages.content: yeah gelatinous cube is a bomb-relic, so strong
Why isn't it a rare relic?
It's effect is almost worthy of such due to how many enemies give you status cards
imagine getting it on floor 0
or getting it from mind bloom
or getting it from double orb walkers
Oh my god

basically:
it isn't a rare relic because <Mummified Hand> isn't

embeds.title: Mummified Hand
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All

Whenever you play a Power card, a random card in your hand costs 0 that turn.
*Frequently twitches, especially when your pulse is high.*

messages.content: Ah ok
instantly solving most of issue with sentries is p good

to CovertMuffin:
you would lose 7 max hp for gelatinous cube, right?
<makeshift battery> moment

embeds.title: Makeshift Battery
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All

Gain **:e_colorless:** and add a Slimed into your discard pile at the start of your turn.
*It's an 8.9 volt.*

messages.content: Also chosen reptomancer hell sometimes even book of stabbing
Makes taskmasters easier although not by much
oh of course
Immediately look for 1-2 status generators or a compile error card ie <buggy mess>

embeds.title: Buggy Mess
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 (0) :e_automaton: / The Automaton

**Insert** a Dazed.
Gain 1 **:e_automaton:** .
**Encode.**

messages.content: I mean also <max output> is already so strong, especially when upgraded; that plus gelatinous cube is absolutely a powerhouse

embeds.title: Max Output
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 (0) :e_automaton: / The Automaton

Draw 3 cards.
At the start of each turn, draw 1 additional card and **Insert** 1 Dazed.

messages.content: and I think that is a really significant thing, gelatinous cube with a maximum of 1-2 status generator cards blitzes through your deck as automaton; then you don't flood your deck with status generators so you can deal with enemies that insert status cards (especially at higher ascension levels)
same way that <runic pyramid> can cause you trouble

embeds.title: Runic Pyramid
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All

At the end of your turn, you no longer discard your hand.
*The runes are indecipherable.*

messages.content: fake card, its not even real. Automation having a balanced damage common, cannot be true

even if it was to be a real card, it would be fairly underwhelming on a character with such a stacked attack card pool. And sure if it was real it could serve as card draw on a character that lacks draw; but it needs an upgrade to have any value which is not an easy ask on auto who wants to upgrade like half of its cards. Of course you would never upgrade this card because its not real.

There are 2 situations where you take this, you either need damage commons to get through act 1 still (and haven't seen the stronger ones that fit better with compiling functions), or you see an upgraded copy in act 2 or 3, in a spot where the card draw is really valuable to you. It's an awkward card in many ways, because you really want to trim your deck down to mainly functions for the second cycle, and this gets in the way, even though it's technically card draw. I could see spots where you really want to quickly draw through your deck and find key powers to assemble certain scaling elements, and this is functional there, but for the most part, you would vastly prefer damage commons that get out of the way of your inherent strong scaling through functions instead.
